thread.title: Not Pogba, not Silva, not Ozil… Cesar Azpilicueta was the Premier League's top passer at the weekend
thread.title_full: Not Pogba, not Silva, not Ozil… Cesar Azpilicueta was the Premier League's top passer at the weekend

author: Richard Innes
title: Not Pogba, not Silva, not Ozil… Cesar Azpilicueta was the Premier League's top passer at the weekend
text:
Not Pogba, not Silva, not Ozil… Cesar Azpilicueta was the Premier League's top passer at the weekend Chelsea's Spanish defender is officially the Premier League's pass master Share Cesar Azpilicueta - the top-flight's top passer (Photo: Darren Walsh) Share   Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Cesar Azpilicueta is known for several things. 
Being the best right-back in England. Proving himself a key part of Antonio Conte's Chelsea by having the flexibility to become part of a back three. People preferring to call him 'Dave' rather try to pronounce his surname. 
But being the man who plays more passes than anyone else in the Premier League? Even the biggest Chelsea fan might be a little surprised to hear that the 27 year-old was the top-flight's top pass master last weekend. 
Not Paul Pogba, David Silva or Mesut Ozil. The Chelsea defender passed the ball more frequently than any other Premier League player. "Good job, Dave" (Photo: Darren Walsh) 
The stats - courtesy of EA Sports - show that 'Dave' completed 103 passes in the 1-1 draw against Burnley. He didn't attempt 103 passes. He played 103 successful passes. 
In fact, he was the only player to reach three figures. Most completed passes 
No doubt many of you will currently be furiously screaming at your screen/phone, yelling about the fact that defenders just play more passes because they are in their own half, knocking the ball from side to side. 
If you are one of those people, prepare to be silenced by this table: Most completed passes 
Azplicueta played 53 successful passes in the opposition half at Turf Moor, meaning he completed more attacking passes than anyone else this weekend. 
No wonder they love him at Stamford Bridge… 
Data Courtesy of EA SPORTS, the Lead Partner of the Premier League. Like us on Facebook
